claim: Marco Polo travelled with Christopher Columbus.

supporting.text: Marco Polo lived in the 13th century (1254–1324), while Christopher Columbus lived in the 15th–16th centuries (1451–1506), making their lifetimes non-overlapping.

attacks.text: Marco Polo lived in the 13th century (1254–1324), while Christopher Columbus lived in the 15th–16th centuries (1451–1506), making their lifetimes non-overlapping.

There is no scientific or historical evidence supporting the possibility of time travel or similar phenomena.

supporting.text: Historical records confirm Marco Polo's travels were to Asia, while Columbus's voyages were to the Americas, with no evidence of collaboration or shared journeys.
